meanings.definition: The belief that different races possess distinct characteristics, abilities, or qualities, especially so as to distinguish them as inferior or superior to one another.
meanings.sent1: Some people still hold onto outdated racisms, thinking one race is better than another.
meanings.sent2: Racisms have no place in a fair and just society.
meanings.sent3: The racisms of the past seem silly now, as we know all races are equal.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like sharp racisms, cutting through the unity of the community.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the harm of racisms using simple examples that everyone could understand.

meanings.definition: Discrimination or prejudice based on race.
meanings.sent1: Racisms can lead to unfair treatment and hurtful actions.
meanings.sent2: It is important to stand up against any form of racisms.
meanings.sent3: The racisms in the movie were so exaggerated, it became comical.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of racisms loomed over the peaceful town, causing tension among neighbors.
meanings.sent5: The impact of racisms on individuals can be long-lasting and damaging.
